Package io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider

Class BlockLootProviderBase

java.lang.Object
io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider.BlockLootProviderBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.minecraft.data.DataProvider
public abstract class BlockLootProviderBase extends Object implements net.minecraft.data.DataProvider
A base class for block loot providers. An extending class should call the customLootTable methods in setup to adjust the loot tables. Every block of your mod that is left untouched will get a default loot table.

  • Method Details

    • customLootTable

      protected void customLootTable(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block block)
      The given block will not be processed by this provider. Useful when you want to create the loot table manually.

    • customLootTable

      protected void customLootTable(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block block, net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.LootTable.Builder loot)
      The given block will get the given loot table.

      The given block will get the given loot table function.

    • setup

      protected abstract void setup()

    • copyNBT

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier copyNBT(String... tags)
      Creates a loot modifier that copies NBT-Data from a block entity into the dropped item. Use this with one of the drops methods.
      Parameters:
      tags - The toplevel tags of the block entity to be copied.

    • copyProperties

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier copyProperties(net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.properties.Property<?>... properties)
      Creates a loot modifier that copies properties from a block state into the dropped item. Use this with one of the drops methods.
      Parameters:
      properties - The properties of the block state to be copied.

    • drops

      public void drops(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b, boolean silk, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack... drops)
      Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
      Parameters:
      b - The block to add the loot table to.
      silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
      drops - A list of stacks that will all be dropped if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

    • drops

      public void drops(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b, boolean silk, net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?>... loot)
      Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
      Parameters:
      b - The block to add the loot table to.
      silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
      loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

    • drops

      public void drops(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b, boolean silk, BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
      Parameters:
      b - The block to add the loot table to.
      silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
      loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

    • drops

      public void drops(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b, BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
      Parameters:
      b - The block to add the loot table to.
      loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied.

    • drops

      public void drops(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b, BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier silk, BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
      Parameters:
      b - The block to add the loot table to.
      silk - Either null in which case no special handling of silk touch is done or a LootModifier that can modify the stack after mining with silk touch.
      loot - A list of loot factories that are used when silk ouch is either null or the block is mined without silk touch. All of them will be applied.

    • item

      public BlockLootProviderBase.SimpleLootFactory item()
      Gets a simple loot factory to always drop the block as item.

    • silk

      public BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier silk(BlockLootProviderBase.GenericLootModifier modifier)
      Turns a generic loot modifier into a silk modifier. This exists to reduce ambiguity. A silk modifier does not extend BlockLootProviderBase.GenericLootModifier for this reason.

    • noSilk

      public BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier noSilk()
      Gets a new silk modifier that means: No special silk touch behaviour.

    • repeat

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory repeat(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory factory, int times)
      Repeats a loot factory a fixed amount of times.

      Turns a singleton loot entry into a simple loot factory.

      Turns a loot entry into a loot factory.

      Turns a loot function into a loot modifier.

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier fortuneOres()
      A loot modifier to apply fortune based on the formula used for ores.

    • random

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder random(float chance)
      A condition that is random with a chance.

    • randomFortune

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder randomFortune(float baseChance)
      A condition that is random with a chance and optionally different chances for different fortune levels. Chances for different levels are computed automatically.

    • randomFortune

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder randomFortune(float baseChance, float... levelChances)
      A condition that is random with a chance and optionally different chances for different fortune levels.
      Parameters:
      baseChance - The chance without fortune.
      levelChances - the chances with fortune.

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier count(int count)
      A loot modifier that sets the count of a stack.

    • count

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier count(int min, int max)
      A loot modifier that uniformly sets the count of a stack between two values.

    • countBinomial

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier countBinomial(float chance, int num)
      A loot modifier that sets the count of a stack based on a binomial formula.

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder or(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder... conditions)

    • combine

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?> combine(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?>... loot)
      Combines the given loot builders into one. (All loot builders will be applied).

    • combine

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory combine(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Combines the given loot factories into one. (All loot factories will be applied).

    • random

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?> random(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?>... loot)
      Combines the given loot builders into one. (One loot builder will be applied).

    • random

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory random(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Combines the given loot factories into one. (One loot factory will be applied).

    • first

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?> first(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?>... loot)
      Combines the given loot builders into one. Only the first matching builder is applied.

    • first

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory first(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Combines the given loot factories into one. Only the first matching factory is applied.

    • whileMatch

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?> whileMatch(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.entries.LootPoolEntryContainer.Builder<?>... loot)
      Combines the given loot builders into one. From all the loot entries until the first one not matching, one is selected.

    • whileMatch

      public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory whileMatch(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
      Combines the given loot factories into one. From all the loot factories until the first one not matching, one is selected.

    • stack

      public BlockLootProviderBase.WrappedLootEntry stack(net.minecraft.world.level.ItemLike item)
      A loot factory for a specific item.

    • matchTool

      public BlockLootProviderBase.MatchToolBuilder matchTool(net.minecraft.world.level.ItemLike item)
      Gets a loot condition builder for a match tool condition.

    • matchTool

      public BlockLootProviderBase.MatchToolBuilder matchTool(net.minecraft.tags.TagKey<net.minecraft.world.item.Item> item)
      Gets a loot condition builder for a match tool condition.

    • silkCondition

      public net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition.Builder silkCondition()
      Gets a loot condition for silk touch tools.

    • stack

      public BlockLootProviderBase.WrappedLootEntry stack(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Tries to create the best possible representation of stack in a loot entry.

    • defaultBehavior

      @Nullable protected net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.LootTable.Builder defaultBehavior(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block b)
      Creates a default loot table for the given block. Can be overridden to alter default behaviour. Should return null if no loot table should be generated.

    • needsLootTable

      protected boolean needsLootTable(net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.BlockState state)
      Returns whether this block state needs a loot table. If all block states of a block don't need a loot table, defaultBehavior will return null for that block. Can be overridden to alter the behaviour.
